Package it.polimi.ingsw.shared

Class MessageDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.shared.MessageDispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class MessageDispatcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    This class asynchronously dispatches the messages from the input and output queues provided a supplier and a consumer for those messages

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private InputMessageQueue inputMessageQueue
      The input queue
      private IOSupplier<Message> inputMessageSupplier
      The supplier of input messages
      protected java.util.logging.Logger logger
      Logging utility
      private IOConsumer<Message> outputMessageConsumer
      The consumer of output messages
      private java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Message> outputMessageQueue
      The output queue
      private java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService receiveThreadPool
      The thread pools that executes the IO tasks in background
      private java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService sendThreadPool  
      private java.util.Set<MessageDispatcherStoppedListener> stoppedListeners
      A list of listeners for the event MessageDispatcherStopped
      private static int TAKE_TIMEOUT_MILLISECONDS
      Timeout needed to prevent deadlocks

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageDispatcher

        public MessageDispatcher​(InputMessageQueue inputMessageQueue,
                         java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Message> outputMessageQueue,
                         IOSupplier<Message> inputMessageSupplier,
                         IOConsumer<Message> outputMessageConsumer)
        Constructs a MessageDispatcher class that manages the passed queues
        Parameters:
        inputMessageQueue - the input message queue that will be filled by messages received by the supplier
        outputMessageQueue - the output message queue that will be emptied by the output message consumer
        inputMessageSupplier - the object that will provide messages
        outputMessageConsumer - the object that will consume messages

    • Method Detail

      • receiveMessageAsync

        private void receiveMessageAsync()
        Receives messages from the supplier and put them into the inputMessageQueue

      • sendMessageAsync

        private void sendMessageAsync()
        Takes messages from the outputMessageQueue and uses the outputMessageConsumer to consume them
